page.title: 08School outings
page.content: Every year we go on school trips from out school. Recently some of the second year children went on a visit to Hadrians Wall in Northumberland. Stephen wrote "We left school at 9.17 am. The bus wen6 up onto the A19 and went through Sunderland at 9.30am. By 9.55am we were out of Newcaste. We had to walk up a very steep hill to reach Hadrians Wall. I took 2 photographs of a milecastle." Paul wrote " on June 19 all the second year children went to Hadrians Wall. It was sunny but it was a little bit cloudy though it never rained. When we got there the teachers gave us our quiz sheets and we set off It was a big hill. We saw the fort, the hospital, the headquarters and the commanders' house. We went along the Roman Wall and one extraordinary thing was that the Romans ate snails and frogs legs."
